result.execSummary:
The defendant John A. BORNDAHL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Chad Blish, 1215 26th Street, Two Rivers, WI  54241.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 

AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 01-15-15 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with the Chadderbox Bar and Grill.
